unnormalised: **New Wheels Alert! What's Hot Off the Assembly Line, Yaar?**
normalised: **New Wheels Alert! What's Hot Off the Assembly Line, Yaar?**

unnormalised: Namaste folks! Another month, another flurry of shiny new vehicles hitting the Indian roads. As always, the automotive scene is buzzing louder than a Mumbai local during peak hours! Let's dive into the recent launches, shall we?
normalised: Namaste folks! Another month, another flurry of shiny new vehicles hitting the Indian roads. As always, the automotive scene is buzzing louder than a Mumbai local during peak hours! Let's dive into the recent launches, shall we?

unnormalised: First up, we have Maruti Suzuki's new compact SUV, the "Breeza Bhai," starting at an attractive Rs. 7.99 Lakhs. They’re really playing the value-for-money card, aren't they? Word on the street is that it offers amazing mileage, perfect for navigating those crazy Delhi traffic jams. It's got some cool features like a sunroof and a decent infotainment system.
normalised: First up, we have Maruti Suzuki's new compact S U V, the "Breeza Bhai," starting at an attractive rupee seven point ninety nine lakhs. They’re really playing the value-for-money card, aren't they? Word on the street is that it offers amazing mileage, perfect for navigating those crazy Delhi traffic jams. It's got some cool features like a sunroof and a decent infotainment system.

unnormalised: Then there’s Tata Motors’ offering, the "Indica 2.0" (okay, I made that name up, but they SHOULD bring it back!). Jokes aside, their latest electric SUV boasts a range of around 450 km on a single charge, which is seriously impressive. Dr. Sharma from IIT-Kanpur even said their battery tech is top-notch! Plus, it looks sleek – definitely a head-turner on the Bandra-Worli Sea Link.
normalised: Then there’s Tata Motors’ offering, the "Indica two point zero" (okay, I made that name up, but they SHOULD bring it back!). Jokes aside, their latest electric S U V boasts a range of around four hundred and fifty kilometer on a single charge, which is seriously impressive. Doctor Sharma from I I T-Kanpur even said their battery tech is top-notch! Plus, it looks sleek – definitely a head-turner on the Bandra-Worli Sea Link.

unnormalised: And lastly, Mahindra has launched a limited edition Thar (called the "Desert King") with a rugged, desert-themed design. This beast can probably climb the Himalayas! Think of it as your personal fortress on wheels, ready to tackle any terrain.
normalised: And lastly, Mahindra has launched a limited edition Thar (called the "Desert King") with a rugged, desert-themed design. This beast can probably climb the Himalayas! Think of it as your personal fortress on wheels, ready to tackle any terrain.

unnormalised: We also hear murmurs about Hyundai revamping their showrooms with a new layout, claiming an average dealership size of 5,000 sq ft. This should provide better customer experience and more space to check out their vehicles.
normalised: We also hear murmurs about Hyundai revamping their showrooms with a new layout, claiming an average dealership size of five thousand square feet. This should provide better customer experience and more space to check out their vehicles.

unnormalised: The competition is fierce, and customers are spoiled for choice. I can't wait to see what cool innovations and models are on their way! Keep your eyes peeled and wallets ready! Do let me know which launch has you most excited in the comments below! Happy driving!
normalised: The competition is fierce, and customers are spoiled for choice. I can't wait to see what cool innovations and models are on their way! Keep your eyes peeled and wallets ready! Do let me know which launch has you most excited in the comments below! Happy driving!
